page.title: 07RIVER WEY AND WEY NAVIGATION
page.content: The River Wey and Wey Navigation is to the west of Send. There is a towpath from the Cartbridge, in Send, to Guildford. Above Ashburton Footbridge is Worsfold Gates where a new flood system is in operation. Triggs Lock is an 18th century lock-keeper's cottage. From here is a view across the flood plain of the river to Send Church and the North Downs beyond. Later the Wey flows round the Sutton Park Estate. The principal traffic in the past was timber and agricultural produce to London and corn brought back to many mills. Grain traffic from London Docks to Coxes Mill, Weybridge ceased in 1969. The Wey Navigation is now used solely for leisure. Narrow boats, motor cruisers, etc. can be hired. The Waterway was given to the National Trust in 1964.
